quotes.quote: Of all the things you choose in life, you don't get to choose what your nightmares are. You don't pick them; they pick you.
It's been like a bad dream I never woke from.
I want to keep my dreams, even bad ones, because without them, I might have nothing all night long.
Bad dreams are ghosts of our fears and worries, haunting us while we sleep. I doubt Valek is in trouble.
There are bad dreams for those who sleep unwisely.
It's weird when you wake of from a bad dream and everything is still bad.
There is an excitement about having nightmares.
Nightmares are releases.
It's real simple - we all have nightmares, and the idea you can be in real jeopardy in them is a great gimmick. It's universal.
I drag myself out of nightmares each morning and find there's no relief in waking.
I have had dreams and I have had nightmares, but I have conquered my nightmares because of my dreams.
I told my therapist I was having nightmares about nuclear explosions. He said don't worry it's not the end of the world.
I still have nightmares about taking tests.
I used to have nightmares about the Antichrist - what would happen, where it would come from, and who it would be.
I've had a quite a few nightmares about being chased by walkers.
Unfortunately, the balance of nature decrees that a super-abundance of dreams is paid for by a growing potential for nightmares.
Most of my nightmares involve me forgetting my lines in a stage play.
I don't know if I'm dreaming when I sleep or sleeping while I'm awake, but I have reoccurring dreams my mind cannot take
I very often have night terrors. Just think of the worst possible situation, and it's a regular thing for me. I've died in my sleep twenty-three different ways.
"For the night is dark and full of terrors.

It is a good viewpoint to see the world as a dream. When you have something like a nightmare, you will wake up and tell yourself that it was only a dream. It is said that the world we live in is not a bit different from this.
My uncle's house burned down when I was 6 years old. We got out safely. But ever since, I've had a nightmare of dying in a fire.

In fact I have nightmares about having children. I want to carry a baby and feel the life within me and in my dream, I do. But every time after it's born, there's this incredible fear, this pounding pulse of fear. It's a real bad nightmare.
Dear God, let this be just a bad nightmare.
Put the nightmare together. If you do not wake up screaming, you have not put it together well.
Nothing like being in a dream, then waking up to a nightmare.
Waking among the dead, one wondered if one was still alive. And yet real despair only seized us later. Afterwards. As we emerged from the nightmare and began to search for meaning.
Have you ever noticed there is never any third act to a nightmare? They bring you to a climax of terror and then leave you there.
The worst nightmare I ever had about Vietnam was that I had to go back. I woke up in a sweat, in total terror.
Where hopes are unrealistic, fears often become exaggerated; where dreams alone are blueprints, nightmares result.
